conclusion: Read data from p-V diagram: A pA = 3×10^5 Pa, VA = 1×10^-3 m^3; B pB = 3×10^5 Pa, VB = 4×10^-3 m^3; C pC = 1×10^5 Pa, VC = 4×10^-3 m^3
List given data: TA = –73 °C = 200 K, ΔUAC = UC – UA = +200 J, Avogadro’s number NA = 6.0×10^23 mol^-1
Express internal-energy change of an ideal gas: U = n CV T, ΔU = n CV ΔT = n CV (TC – TA)
Eliminate n and ΔT using ideal-gas equation: ΔT = (pCVC – pAVA)/(nR), ΔU = CV (pCVC – pAVA)/R
Calculate (pCVC – pAVA): pAVA = 300 J, pCVC = 400 J, pCVC – pAVA = 100 J
Determine CV from equation: ΔU = 200 J = CV (100 J)/R, CV = 2R
Find number of moles using state A: n = 300 J / (8.314 J mol^-1 K^-1 × 200 K) ≈ 0.180 mol
Convert moles to molecules: N = 0.180 mol × 6.0×10^23 mol^-1 = 1.08×10^23 ≈ 1.1×10^23
